message:
WEEK 2 — MONDAY: Squat (Accumulation)

Main Lift:
- Competition Squat: 5×5 @ RPE 7-8 (~70-75% 1RM), rest 3min

Secondary:
- Pause Squat (2sec): 4×3 @ RPE 7, rest 2-3min

Accessories:
- RDL: 3×8 @ RPE 7-8, rest 2min
- Bulgarian Split Squat: 3×10/leg @ RPE 8, rest 90sec
- Leg Press: 3×12-15 @ RPE 8, rest 90sec

Notes: Building work capacity. If Week 1 felt RPE 7, add 5-10lbs today. Focus on bar speed—if it slows significantly on reps 4-5, reduce next set. Track: weight, reps, RPE, bar speed notes. Session: ~85min.

WEEK 2 — TUESDAY: Bench (Accumulation)

Main Lift:
- Competition Bench: 5×5 @ RPE 7-8 (~70-75% 1RM), rest 3min

Secondary:
- Close-Grip Bench: 4×6 @ RPE 7-8, rest 2-3min

Accessories:
- Incline DB Press: 3×8-10 @ RPE 8, rest 2min
- Barbell Row: 4×8 @ RPE 7-8, rest 2min
- Face Pulls: 3×15-20 @ RPE 8, rest 90sec
- DB Overhead Triceps Ext: 3×10-12 @ RPE 8, rest 90sec

Notes: Primary bench day—heaviest pressing volume. Perfect setup critical (feet, arch, shoulder blades). If Week 1 felt easy, add 5lbs. Upper back work (rows/face pulls) prevents shoulder issues. Session: ~80min.

WEEK 2 — THURSDAY: Deadlift (Accumulation)

Main Lift:
- Competition Deadlift: 5×4 @ RPE 7-8 (~70-75% 1RM), rest 3min

Secondary:
- Deficit Deadlift (1-2"): 4×3 @ RPE 7, rest 3min
- Front Squat: 3×6 @ RPE 7-8 (~60-65% back squat 1RM), rest 2-3min

Accessories:
- GHR/Nordic Curls: 3×8-10 @ RPE 8, rest 2min
- Leg Curls: 3×12-15 @ RPE 8, rest 90sec

Notes: Most taxing day. Perfect setup every rep: bar over mid-foot, lats engaged, big brace. Don't grind reps—if bar speed slows or back rounds, stop set. Front squat maintains frequency (2x/week). Session: ~90min.

WEEK 6 — MONDAY: Squat (Wave Loading: 82.5%)

Main Lift:
- Competition Squat: 4×3 @ RPE 8-9 (82.5% 1RM), rest 3-4min

Secondary:
- Front Squat: 3×5 @ RPE 8, rest 3min

Accessories:
- RDL: 3×6-8 @ RPE 8, rest 2min
- Leg Press: 3×10-12 @ RPE 8, rest 90sec

Notes: Week 2 of wave (Week 5: 80%, Week 6: 82.5%, Week 7: 85%). Bar speed critical—third rep should be hard but fast. If grinds >3sec, reduce 10lbs next set. Rest 3-4min (full recovery essential). Accessories reduced to preserve energy. Week 7 will be hardest, then Week 8 deload. Session: ~80min.

WEEK 6 — TUESDAY: Bench (Wave Loading: 82.5%)

Main Lift:
- Competition Bench: 4×3 @ RPE 8-9 (82.5% 1RM), rest 3-4min

Secondary:
- Close-Grip Bench: 3×5 @ RPE 8, rest 3min

Accessories:
- Barbell Row: 3×6-8 @ RPE 8, rest 2min
- Incline DB Press: 3×8-10 @ RPE 8, rest 2min
- Face Pulls: 3×15-20 @ RPE 7-8, rest 90sec

Notes: 82.5% feels significantly heavier than Week 5's 80%. Perfect setup non-negotiable—spotter assists liftoff. Third rep challenging but controlled; if stalls mid-press, reduce 5lbs. Face pulls maintained (shoulder health). Competition > percentages. Session: ~75min.

WEEK 6 — THURSDAY: Deadlift (Wave Loading: 82.5%)

Main Lift:
- Competition Deadlift: 4×2-3 @ RPE 8-9 (82.5% 1RM), rest 3-4min

Secondary:
- Deficit Deadlift: 3×2 @ RPE 7-8, rest 3min
- Front Squat: 3×5 @ RPE 7-8, rest 2-3min

Accessories:
- GHR: 3×8 @ RPE 8, rest 2min

Notes: Deadlifts at 82.5% are brutal. Some lifters only manage 2 reps (acceptable). If second or third rep grinds >4-5sec or form breaks, STOP SET. Perfect setup every rep. Friday is rest—use it. Sleep 7-8hr tonight. Session: ~85min.

WEEK 10 — MONDAY: Squat (Peaking: 92.5% Doubles)

Main Lift:
- Competition Squat: 3×2 @ RPE 9.5 (92.5% 1RM), rest 4-5min

Maintenance:
- Light Front Squat: 2×5 @ RPE 7 (~55-60% back squat), rest 2-3min
- Light RDL: 2×8-10 @ RPE 6-7, rest 2min

Notes: Near-maximal. First rep should move with decent speed; second will grind—expected. If second stalls or >6sec, reduce 10lbs. All accessories eliminated except light maintenance. Rest 4-5min between sets. Sleep 8-9hr non-negotiable. Visualize Thursday's deadlifts. Session: ~75min.

WEEK 10 — TUESDAY: Bench (Peaking: 92.5% Doubles)

Main Lift:
- Competition Bench: 3×2 @ RPE 9.5 (92.5% 1RM), rest 4-5min

Maintenance:
- Light Close-Grip: 2×5 @ RPE 7, rest 2-3min
- Face Pulls: 2×15-20 @ RPE 6-7, rest 90sec

Notes: Setup is everything. Spotter MUST be present—communicate liftoff. First rep controlled; second will slow but must complete without assistance. If bar stalls, weight too heavy. All energy to competition lifts. Week 11: heavy singles (95-97.5%), then Week 12 taper. Session: ~70min.

WEEK 10 — THURSDAY: Deadlift (Peaking: 92.5% Singles/Doubles)

Main Lift:
- Competition Deadlift: 3×1-2 @ RPE 9.5 (92.5% 1RM), rest 5min

Maintenance:
- Light High-Bar Squat: 2×5 @ RPE 6, rest 2-3min

Notes: CRITICAL: If first rep >4sec or RPE 9.5, do NOT attempt second. Quality > Quantity. Perfect setup: bar mid-foot, lats engaged, 360° brace. Many lifters do singles only—that's smart. Most demanding session of program. Friday: complete rest. Sleep 8-9hr. Session: ~80min.
